Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or supporting information to back up the assertion that the statement made by the BJP MP is insensitive.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the statement made by the BJP MP is insensitive without providing any context or counterarguments.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the statement made by the BJP MP was not related to the recent Pulwama attack but was made in January 2018.
Understate: The claim may understate the impact and controversy caused by the statement made by the BJP MP by not providing enough details about the massive furore it caused.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim suggests that the portrayal of the statement as a recent one in the wake of the Pulwama attack is mischievous and politically opportunistic, implying that there may be alternative motives behind the viral circulation of the statement.
